results.title: Centripetal force and satellite orbits
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how mass, velocity and radius affect the magnitude of centripetal force. States this effect in equation form and solves a problem involving the velocity needed to hold a satellite in orbit. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Demonstrates how mass, velocity and radius affect the magnitude of centripetal force. States this effect in equation form and solves a problem involving the velocity needed to hold a satellite in orbit. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Centre stage = Yuen Ling Yuk
results.creator_credit: Paragon Films, Chui Siu Ming, Willie Chan Chi Keung and Stanley Kwan
results.brief_description: Based on the real life of Chinese silent movie star Ruan Lingyu, ‘Centre Stage’ brings back to life the golden age of the ‘Hollywood of the East’, the Lienhau studios of Shanghai in the 1930s. Ruan (Maggie Cheung) is already an established star at age 20 when her world starts to collapse. First married to an immature, pleasure seeking play boy, she obtains a costly divorce in order to set-up house with Tang Chi Shan (Tony Leung Ka-fai), a producer at Lienhua who is also a married man. Tired of playing melodramatic characters, Ruan accepts a role in film directed by an up and coming director titled ‘New Woman’. The film is a vicious attack of the Chinese press whose tabloid style is pushing a woman to destruction. The press retaliates so violently that massive cuts are ordered to appease the anger of the opinion makers. This is the time Ruan’s ex-husband re-appears and threatens to expose her as an adulteress. Ruan’s star starts to spiral down. The film blends fact and fiction, documentary and narrative. Rare footage of the real Ruan’s performances are mixed with Cheung’s re-creations of Ruan’s lost films. In a clever twist of casting, the role of Ruan, originally intended for Anita Mui (Kwan’s star in ‘Rouge’), went to Maggie Cheung. Cheung was the same age as Ruan at the time of her suicide and had had many run-ins with the Hong Kong press. Kwan blends his narrative with documentary style footage of Cheung explaining how she researched the part and interviews with Chinese cinema veterans. The result is an interrogation on cinema itself. The film won several awards, including the Silver Bear for Best Actress at the 1992 Berlin Film Festival. Also stars Carina Lau, Waise Lee, Cecilia Yip. In Cantonese with English subtitles. The film is also known as ‘The Actress’, ‘The New China Woman’ in various English releases or ‘Ruan Ling-yu’ in Mandarin.

results.title: Centre stage = Center stage (Collector's edition)
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures Corporation, Laurence Mark and Nicholas Hytner
results.brief_description: In this teen ensemble drama, the fortunes of several young ambitious dancers are determined over one year’s tuition in a prestigious New York dance school, as they compete for just a few contested places. Jody is the sweet natured ingenue outclassed by the elite students of the school; Maureen is the child protegee dealing with bulimia and a domineering stage mum; Eva is the African-American rebel seeking validation from her peers. The students struggle with the demands of the school and their personal relationships that at times threaten to thwart the achievement of their exacting goal. Most characters are drawn from stock stereotypes (from the “Fame” repertoire), but the drama is affective in its evocation of the young protagonists’ qualms about their uncertain future. Real dancers play most of the main characters, which explains some of the wooden acting, and although the narrative progression is far from unpredictable, the dance sequences are quite stunning and fun to watch. The narrative also touches on body image among female dancers and old style choreography and teaching methods, versus a modern approach. Cast includes: Amanda Schullm, Zoe Saldana, Susan May Pratt, Donna Murphy, Debra Monk, Ethan Stiefel, Sascha Radetsky.

results.title: Centre court champions
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, British Petroleum and Howard Rubie
results.brief_description: Demonstrations of good play in tennis on a grass court and a hard court with comments by Harry Hopman. Emphasizes the need for good balance, skill in service, a great variety of strokes, and agile footwork; with some sequences in slow motion. Top Australian players are shown in action, including Tony Roche, John Newcombe, Owen Davidson and Lesley Turner. Concludes with the 1965 Australian Singles Finals, in black and white, with Roy Emerson and Fred Stolle.

results.title: Centralia
results.brief_description: Depicts scenic places around Alice Springs, Stanley’s Chasm, Hermannsburg, Ormiston Gorge, Glen Helen Gorge, Ayres Rock and The Olgas, and discusses the geology, history, living conditions and aboriginal mythology of the areas shown. Narrated by Ron Haddrick.
results.description: Depicts scenic places around Alice Springs, Stanley’s Chasm, Hermannsburg, Ormiston Gorge, Glen Helen Gorge, Ayres Rock and The Olgas, and discusses the geology, history, living conditions and aboriginal mythology of the areas shown. Narrated by Ron Haddrick.

results.title: Central station = Central do Brasil
results.creator_credit: Videos Films, Mact Productions, Miramax Films, Martine de Clermont-Tonnerre, Arthur Cohn and Walter Salles
results.brief_description: Dora (Fernanda Montenegro) is a retired school teacher who now makes her living writing letters for people in Rio de Janeiro’s hectic Central Station. Embittered by her poverty and hard life she never posts the letters she writes for the city’s illiterates. Her life is drastically changed, however, when a young boy, Josue (Vinicius de Oliveira), insists she post a letter his mother had written to his estranged father shortly before she was killed. Initially resistant, Dora takes responsibility for Josue and they begin a long road journey through the heart of the country to find Josue’s father. “Central Station” is a film that celebrates the humanity of its characters whilst refusing to either exploit or diminish the brutal realities of life for Brazil’s homeless and working poor. Whether showing us the squalor of Rio, the vast mountainous beauty of southern Brazil, the ecstatic richness of a religious festival or the endless uniform drabness of working class estates, Walter Salles’ direction remains assured and free of sentimentality. The performances by Montenegro, de Oliveira and Marila Pera are outstanding. Winner of the Golden Bear at the 1998 Berlin Film Festival. In Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: Central similarities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allen Downs, Jay Hines and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Dilatations (central similarities) are introduced to solve the problem of inscribing an ellipse to touch the sides of a given triangle at their midpoints. Coordinate geometry is also introduced to solve a subsidiary problem stressing the importance of the geometric interpretation of algebraic equations. Narrated by Delbert Ball.

results.title: Central perspectives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Art Landy and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Reviews the definition of range and pencil. Introduces the basic projective transformation, namely the central perspectivity. When the narrator poses the question of the number of points required to uniquely determine a projectivity (product of perspectivity) the viewer is led to the fundamental theorem of projective geometry.

results.title: Central experimental farm
results.brief_description: Canada runs the largest system of experimental farms in the world. The headquarters of this system is the Dominion Experimental Farm in Ottawa, whose staff of experts is shown at work. Experts in plant nutrition, soil research, food preservation, animal husbandry, cereal improvements and the use of farm machinery are seen at work. In brief scenes we are told something about the aims of the Cereal Division, where scientists are working to produce better grades of wheat. Experiments in poultry breeding to increase egg production, tests of different varieties of commercial seed, and the development of better breeds of livestock are among the activities shown in other divisions. Farmers visit the farm and are given practical demonstrations of improved methods.

results.title: Central Australia: tracks in the sand (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Cartoonist Michael Leunig records his impressions of Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and the vast emptiness of the Simpson Desert. Viewers are privy to a special meeting of minds and cultures when he shares a canvas on the sand with Aboriginal artist, Michael Nelson.
